title: HW02 - String Comparison
description:
HW02 - String Comparison

Note: Some systems may show output as 1 or 0, but they represent true or false. Your function should return a boolean.

Given two strings, determine if they are exactly identical. The comparison is case-sensitive and considers all characters including whitespace.

Examples:

  • Input: s1 = "hello", s2 = "hello"
    Output: true
  • Input: s1 = "Hello", s2 = "hello"
    Output: false
  • Input: s1 = "", s2 = ""
    Output: true

Constraints:

  • Strings can be empty
  • Case-sensitive comparison
  • Whitespace matters
solution_text:
String Comparison

Algorithm:

  1. Use Python's built-in equality operator
  2. Return the boolean result

Time Complexity: O(n) - where n is length of strings

Space Complexity: O(1) - constant space

Key Insights:

  • Python's == operator performs case-sensitive comparison
  • Handles empty strings correctly
  • No need for manual character-by-character comparison
solution_code:
def areStringsEqual(s1, s2):
    return s1 == s2
verify:
def verify(actual_output, expected_output):
    """Verify the boolean result"""
    passed = actual_output == expected_output
    return [passed, str(actual_output)]
